JobFullDesc: Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I Edge Regional Inventory & Asset (I&A) Program Manager, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Microsoft Azure, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and Bing search platforms.  Empower Billions!  Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 100 datacenters and 1 million servers. Our foundation is built upon, and managed by, a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.  DCS Edge Site Operations is the organization responsible for deploying and maintaining hundreds of collocated facilities globally that provide low latency and reliable connectivity for Microsoft Cloud Services to our customers. The Edge Regional Inventory & Asset Program Manager (RIAPM) will be responsible for a regional team of Inventory and Asset Technicians and will be a point of contact for all site operations logistics and escalations supporting Edge datacenter sites in the Region.   As the Regional Inventory & Asset (I&A) Program Manager you will be working to standardize oversight of inventory, spares, asset management, logistics technologies, supply chain, shipping/receiving activities, and related processes/procedures in edge sites, (factoring other inputs such as safety and security). You will be driving quality and consistency in alignment with other regions and global programs to support many datacenters across your geographical region. You will help develop and deliver measures to enable team success in achieving all established KPI’s and SLA’s for the datacenters within your Region.   As a liaison between Edge Site Operations Inventory and Asset Management and global partners, you will collaborate, and leverage outputs to influence global decisions through positive engagement with partner groups.   Excellent people management, customer service, interpersonal awareness, and communication skills will be pivotal in bringing your technical and logistical abilities to life, while supporting Microsoft’s future success!With personnel safety, environmental sustainability, and data security at the forefront of our datacenter design and operations -- we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that make Microsoft a world-class cloud provider.  Be at the forefront of the action in CO+I as part of our global edge datacenter operations!  In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.ResponsibilitiesCore responsibilities will include but are not limited
